intro: Ayapanopsis, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plants are characterized by their showy, nocturnal flowers that open at night and emit a fragrant scent to attract pollinators. Ayapanopsis species typically have thick, succulent stems and broad, waxy leaves adapted to arid conditions. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and unique blooming habits.
